GUI.athlete

Class AthleteSearchPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • GUI.athlete.AthleteSearchPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class AthleteSearchPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Class made to handle GUI for the search panel functionality.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • scrollPane

        private javax.swing.JScrollPane scrollPane
        JSrollPane that contains the JTable. Column usernames don't show unless the JTable(resultsTable) is inside this.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AthleteSearchPanel

        public AthleteSearchPanel()
        Constructor. Creates an UserSearchPanel. It is not a JPanel. To use it you must get the JPanel by calling getMainPanel();

    • Method Detail

      • getMainPanel

        public javax.swing.JPanel getMainPanel()
        Returns the mainPanel/rootPanel.
        Returns:
        JPanel

      • getJTable

        public javax.swing.JTable getJTable()
        Returns the resultTable.
        Returns:
        JTable

      • createColumns

        private void createColumns()
        Creates the four collumns in the JTable. Name, Nationality, Sport and AthleteID. Adds them to the DefaultTableModel, which it gets from the resultsTable by using getModel() and casting to DefaultTableModel. Assigns this model to 'dm'.

      • populateRow

        private void populateRow(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String nationality,
                         java.lang.String sport,
                         java.lang.String athleteID)
        Add one row of data to the DefaultTableModel.
        Parameters:
        name - first and last name of the athlete
        nationality - name of the country the athlete is representing
        sport - main sport the athlete is participating in
        athleteID - ID of the athlete, stored in the WADA-sys database

      • populateRows

        private void populateRows()
        Main function used to populate rows from the SQL server Gets a String[][] of results from the searchConnection class that calls .getAthletes(). Then adds them to the DefaultTableModel using a for-loop.

      • filter

        private void filter(java.lang.String query)
        Takes a String, here called 'query' as a parameter. Then sorts the DefaultTableModel so that only rows containing that word are shown. Also calls on the updateRegexFilter method to ensure it respects the search choices of the client when filtering.
        Parameters:
        query - String. Usually a word. Typed into the TextField.

      • updateRegexFilter

        private javax.swing.RowFilter updateRegexFilter(java.lang.String query)
        Returns a new RowFilter based on the choices of the user. Checks the four JCheckBoxes added to the panel. If the JTextBox is checked it creates a RowFilter.regexFilter based on the query param and adds it to a List of RowFilters. In the end the list is combined into one RowFilter using RowFilter.orFilter()
        Parameters:
        query - The text/query to filter by
        Returns:
        The new combined RowFilter
